botMessages.message: Hi {!Contact.FirstName}, I'm Tracker, your field service assistant. Ask me anything or get started with an option below. At anytime you can return here by saying MAIN MENU:
Goodbye! Click the "End Chat" button to end this chat
Sorry, I didn't understand that.
Select an appointment:

Looks like I couldn't find your contact record. Make sure this messaging user is assigned a contact, and the contact is referenced on a Service Resource object. I'm going to transfer you to an agent, so you can fix this...
{!Contact.FirstName}, I couldn't find any service appointments assigned to you. You can try requesting them from the main menu.
{!Error}
{!Status}
Select an appointment:
Respond with notes to add to the Appointment:
Note added to Appointment.
Sounds good! It's my pleasure to serve you!
You do not have any capacity for the current time period. What would you like to do?
How many hours of capacity should be set for the current {!Capacity.TimePeriod}?
How many jobs of capacity should be set for the current {!Capacity.TimePeriod}?
Capacity updated...
Capacity removed...
What kind of capacity segment would you like to add (Day, Week, or Month)?
How many hours of capacity should be set for the current {!Capacity_Period}?
How many jobs of capacity should be set for the current {!Capacity_Period}?
When would you like the absence to start?
When would you like the absence to end?
Absence created...

Your total capacity is {!Capacity.CapacityInHours}hrs or {!Capacity.CapacityInWorkItems} jobs for the current {!Capacity.TimePeriod}.
Current Usage is: {!Capacity.FSL__HoursInUse__c} hrs used {!Capacity.FSL__Work_Items_Allocated__c} jobs allocated
What would you like to do?
Appointments Requested. Stay tuned for today's assignments...
Select an absence below:
When would you like the absence to start?
When would you like the absence to end?
Absence updated...
Absence deleted...
You do not have any upcoming absences. What would you like to do?
Knowledge Search: What would you like to know?
:::::PUT THE KNOWLEDGE SEARCH COMPONENT HERE:::::
Here's what I found:
{!SelectedArticle.Summary}
